quoteFirst: Sir," answered he, "you are little acquainted with the world. I had at that time false hair, and have learned the art of counterfeiting every age from
quoteLast: ty. Ah, sir! had I but bestowed half the pains in learning a trade that I have in learning to be a scoundrel, I might have been a rich man at this day. But, rogue as I am, still I may be your friend, and that, perhaps, when you least expect it."
title: Dalziels' Illustrated Goldsmith
author: Goldsmith, Oliver, 1730?-1774; Dulcken, H. W. (Henry William), 1832-1894 [Commentator]; Dalziel, George, 1815-1902 [Engraver]; Pinwell, George John, 1842-1875 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: “Perhaps there never was a judge, from
quoteLast: ty, who could look with indifference upon beauty in distress; if he could, he was unfit to be a judge. He should be a stranger to decision, who is a stranger to compassion. All these matters influence the man, and warp his judgment.”
title: History of Greece, Volume 05 (of 12)
author: Grote, George, 1794-1871

quoteLast: . Wellson should be there in a minute--he had said, "At the jail-entrance at 6.45". God send him soon or the new-found self-control might weaken and a rising tide creep up and up until it submerged his will-power again.
title:
Driftwood Spars
The Stories of a Man, a Boy, a Woman, and Certain Other People Who Strangely Met Upon the Sea of Life
author: Wren, Percival Christopher, 1885-1941

quoteFirst: The King and Queen, although they were probably unaware of the fact, were acting upon the advice of an authority on good manners at court a number of years before their time. "Indeed," says the old manuscript, "from seven to seventeen young gentlemen commonly are carefully enough brought up: but from
quoteLast: -and-twenty (the most dangerous time of all a man's life, and the most slippery to stay well in) they have commonly the rein of all license in their own hand, and specially such as do live in the court." If we bring the sentence up to date, and it is as true now as it was then, we may substitute "business" for "court.
title: The Book of Business Etiquette
author: Braddy, Nella, 1894-1973

quoteFirst: You may have heard that name before; but it isn't the Smith you know--it is quite another Smith.  Well, this defunct elder left a small assortment of wives behind him--I think there were seventeen--of all ages, from
quoteLast: ty.  This miscellaneous gathering included three grandmothers, a fact which lent a venerable sanctity to the affair.  I received an invitation--I went--and was introduced to the whole seventeen widows at once.  Sam Weller or Dr.
title: The Complete Works of Artemus Ward — Part 7: Miscellaneous
author: Ward, Artemus, 1834-1867

quoteFirst: It was only on the surface that she was weak; she was susceptible to every kind of suffering, but had a corresponding power of enduring. Few women could have lived as she had done, from
quoteLast: -and-twenty, and have preserved so much cleanliness of soul.
title: Isabel Clarendon, Vol. 2 (of 2)
